result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam R Heimerl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court costs paid from bond posted.

-AODA and any counseling/treatment deemed appropriate.
-Absolute sobriety.
-No controlled substances or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription.
-Random tests.
-Pay supervision fees.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08

Defendant Adam R Heimerl in court with attorney Steven M Cain.  Patti L Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters no contest plea to amended criminal complaint. Court finds defendant guilty and renders sentence.
Order for daily PBT at Saukville PD at 7:00 pm in lieu of scram bracelet. Copy to DA, Atty. Cain, Saukville PD.
Jury trial on June 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on June 23, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Adam R Heimerl in court with attorney Steven M Cain.  Patti L Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Both cases of defendant joined for trial.  Atty. Cain requests trial date. Atty. Cain requests daily pbt at Saukville in lieu of scram bracelet. Atty. Cain to prepare Order and Court will approve.  Jury trial scheduled for June 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for June 23, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Further proceedings on June 2, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Adam R Heimerl in court with attorney Steven M Cain.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Cain needs additional time to resolve this case.  Atty. Cain requests bail modification to remove scram bracelet. Court denies motion.Further proceedings scheduled for June 2, 2014 at 10:00 am.
On request of Atty. Cain, case rescheduled from 6/2/2014 to 5/5/2014 at 2:30 pm. DA notified, Atty. Cain will notify defendant.
Status hearing on June 2, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Adam R Heimerl in court with attorney Steven Michael Cain.  Adam Y. Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Cain stated he is considering offer from the State. Atty. Cain will attempt to reschedule case before 6/2/2014.  Further proceedings scheduled for June 2, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Status hearing on April 7, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Adam R Heimerl in court with attorney Steven Michael Cain.  Atty. Carol Crowley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Cain stated he was recently appointed, requests time to review case before scheduling a preliminary hearing on new case 14CF16.  Further proceedings scheduled for April 7, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Status hearing on March 3, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Atty. Steve Cain will accept court appointment. Defendant notified of appointment and time change from 8:45 am on 3/3/2014 to 10:00 am on 3/3/2014. Copy of complaint, notice and defendant phone # faxed to Atty. Cain.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant Adam R Heimerl in court.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews defendant's petition for appointment of attorney and affidavit of indigency. Court will appoint counsel for defendant.  Defendant to pay $100 per month toward attorney fees commencing 3/1/2014. Court finds good cause to extend timelimits. Court orders bail remain forfeited at this time but may review reinstatement of bail at a later time.  Further proceedings scheduled for March 3, 2014 at 08:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 12, 2014 at 11:15 am.

Conditions set by court:   Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.  No use or possession of controlled substances unless valid prescription and in original containers. Not to be in any bars, taverns,liquor stores.
Note: $250 bail covers both files. (13CF38/14CF16)

Defendant Adam R Heimerl in court, in custody.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears by video conferencing from Ozaukee County Jail. Complaint read. Def states he thought courtdate on 13CF38 file was 1/28 not 1/23. Has SCRAM bracelet on at present time. Def turned self in on 1/30. Bail not addressed on 13CF38 file. Court informs that because it has not been forfeited yet he can address reinstatement with br 1. Preliminary hearing set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 12, 2014 at 11:15 am.
Per Dispatch, subject is in custody on warrant
